name: The Samaya Bali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK, so its not cheap... but for the first time in a looong time I felt we got value in every cent spent! We stayed in the new Royal Courtyard Villas, which are located across the street, tucked behind some local traditional homes. These new villas are beautifully designed, and have struck the best balance for a hotel villa. The bed is huge and so comfortable, the bathrooms are fabulous and the pool area is large, sunny and well designed. There are golf buggies always available to run you back to the original Samaya on the beach.
reviews.title: so great... a new level

reviews.text: Breakfast on the beach at Breeze is a real treat - fantastic menu - and sunset drinks on the lounges are mandatory. Tried the spa, and again it was wonderful and matched the premium prices.
reviews.title: Simply the BEST

reviews.title: Sensational Samaya
reviews.text: 1. First, they can arrange a expedited customs process with the airport. This costs approx. $50 US pp (in addition to $25 Visa pp), but can be worth alleviating the headache. You immediately are taken into a lounge with snacks, drinks, and hot towels while everyone else scrambles to the customs counters. These can be up to and greater than 2 hours to process. They take your passports and process it immediately, and then pick up your bags while you relax. The process took us about 30 minutes before escorted to our transport while 100s of people still waited in the customs line.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Fantastic well kept grounds and the rooms were wonderful w/ a hybrid indoor (enclosed)/outdoor layout that is very contemporary Balinese. The bathroom fixtures offer stone tubs and wood plattes that are beautiful. Don't forget about the plunge pools and comfortable bedding. They even offer bugspray and repellents - be sure to take advantage of them. Bugs are not an issue, but if you don't use repellent (especially in the evenings) you will get bit up by mosquitos. They provide all these bug repellents complimentary.
reviews.title: Fantastic,superbe...I miss it already !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Samaya Hotel was beautiful. The service was outstanding and the rooms amazing. However do not order a carton of Bingtang that which would cost around $25.00 at the shops and they charged us $120. The staff are unbelievable very friendly and welcoming but I was disappointed with the General Manager of this hotel because through no fault of mine I slipped inside on their marble tiles villa and broke my clavical bone and fractured it in four places. They were very good at assisting me at the hospital were the General Manager and Manager of the hotel accompanied me there. I was x -rayed and we were informed that I had broken my bone. I was in too much pain to fly home, and wished to stay there, where i felt a lot more comfortable. When I spoke to the manager within regards to compensation, and paying for my hospital bills, his response was, we take no liability for you slipping, you should have been wearing indoor slippers. I might add the indoor slippers would have caused me more damage if I had them on, as they had no grip what so ever under neath the bottom of the shoe. I might also state, that when the cleaners cleaned our room both day & night, none of them were wearing shoes, or slippers, so why did this rule only apply to me????? I am suggesting to you all, that if you have an incident, make sure they have a sign to state you must wear slippers!!! as they did not have a sign stating this. I was soooooo happy with the ppl who worked here, and it pains me to write this report. However it was blantantly the hotels responsibility in this case to pay my hospital bills and furthur more they did not, and when I asked to extend on because of the fact that I was in serious serious pain.....they told me to book through my travel agent as they would give me a cheaper rate??? A cheaper rate.......wouldnt that have been the least they could do????? One would think??? They have no mats to the entrance of any of the doors when you enter the villa. I was not wet nor was I swimming, so they cannot claim this was the cause. So although they seemed concerned to begin with, they used an excuse of it being a slippery surface because I did not have indoor slippers........WHAT AN ABSOLUTE JOKE. THERE WAS NO DISCOUNT GIVEN NO NOTHING, AND THE MOST IMPORTANT PART I WAS STUCK WITH A VERY HEFTY HOSPITAL TAG. As you can all see Im quite upset. I cannot work for 12 weeks, who wil pay my loss of income? Certainly not them, and for them to use such a stupid excuse of a slipper, when none of the other workers wear slippers while cleaning, was just beyond belief. I have my husband doing everything for me....typing and dressing me etc. The owners of this establishment, should be proud of the ppl whom work for them, as they were wonderful, however management (the english general manager whom made this decision of no compensation what so ever should be overlooked) My husband and I travel 6 times a year..... this certainly doesnt look good, when there is nothing to at least pacify guests for their pain.
reviews.title: A very Important read within regards to management and hurting yourself at hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its pretty much impossible to say anything bad about the Semaya. From the moment we arrived we realised that we had chosen well. The place is just really well run. The staff were great, friendly and helpful but unobtrusive. The Villa was brilliant - the eye for detail was obvious from the garden, pool, decking and inside it was just luxurious! The butlers and concierge service were great and despite being across the road in "Samaya 2" we were not inconvenienced at all - in fact the seclusion was a real plus.
reviews.title: Perfection.... what a lovely place!

reviews.text: The Breezes restaurant is fantastic. Book a couple of chairs for sunset cocktails then dinner on the lawn with the waves crashing onto the beach just yards away ..... Now some reviews have complained about the prices at the restaurant. To be frank they are much the same as the UK. All I say is - if you are going to stay somewhere like the Semaya, don't be so tight fisted. Its a luxury place, accept it or go and stay with the riff raff in Kuta.
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2.5 week honeymoon in Bali and Hong Kong. We heavily researched our trip mainly using trip advisor and and booked the Samaya for 10 days of our holiday on the strengths of the reviews on these pages, As with all expectations if they are too high then it can often be a let down when you actually experience it for yourself. Not in this case! The Samaya is excellent in every way and I can only echo on what the fellow reviewers have already said.
reviews.title: Peace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having heard so much about the personal service and the seemingly omni present Ray Clarke, general manager, we were somewhat disappointed that we did not see or meet him in the first week and we began to wonder if were just not important enough! However it turns out he was on a business trip, we were informed of this unprompted by the very courteous and professional Wayan, the Breeze Restaurant manager. He was obviously standing in for Ray and seemed genuinely interested in our stay, he made a point of coming over to us over breakfast a couple of times and made sure he was at reception to see us off at check out. This for me speaks volumes on what is simply a brilliant hotel that is more in keeping with a boutique resort with friendly, professional an personal service. A special mention has to also go to Suta who served us water and fruit daily whilst we where on the sunbeds, he also had a smile for us and asked how 'Mr Theo and Mrs Michelle' were today and spent a few minutes each time to have a chat. We will genuinely miss him. To sum up:
reviews.title: What makes a hotel different? Its the people that work there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food - The breeze restaurant is excellent, we woke each morning with big smiles knowing that were going to have another great breakfast. Dinner is great, however in keeping with all the 5 star hotels and high end restaurants in Seminyak, it is not cheap especially if you have wine which is very over priced (in seminyak). On terms of other restaurants outside the hotel, Sarong is a must, as is Ku Te Da (do cocktails at sunset as well) La Lucciola (next door) is in our opinion over rated and over priced. For cheaper eats, Rumours is excellent.
reviews.title: In a league of its own

likes.liked: — generous size, bathroom, large villa pool, technology in the room

description: Samaya Seminyak has an outdoor pool, a steam room, a sauna, and a fitness facility. This 5-star Luxury Boutique Seminyak property features massage and treatment rooms, body treatments, and facial treatments. Business amenities at this 5-star Luxury Boutique property include complimentary wireless Internet access and business services. Samaya Seminyak has an award winning restaurant Breeze and a bar/lounge. 24-hour room service is available. Transportation services at this property include a complimentary airport shuttle (available on request) and a complimentary area shuttle within 2000metres. The staff can arrange wedding services, dry cleaning/laundry services, currency exchange, and computer rentals. Additional amenities include valet parking, a concierge desk, and a garden.
